(7) Every member of the Board shail, unless he earlier

for period of three years. Any member of the Board who

(8) If any member of the Board vacates his office prior
to the expiration of his term of office, his successor shall,
unless such successor vacates his office earlier, hold office

per centum of the amount of such contribution.

(8) At the request of the Board, any officer in the public

Secretary to the Ministry of the Minister in charge of

permanently appointed to such staff.
(@ Where any officer in the public service is temporarily

(6) Where any officer of the public service ix permanently

relation to him.
(8) Where the Board employs any person who has
agreed to serve the Government for a specified period, any
period of service to the Board by that person shall be
regarded as service to the Government for the purpose of
discharging the obligations of such agreement,
(7) At the request of the Board any member of the
Local Goverament Service or any other officer or servant

and the Local Government Service Advisory Board or that
local authority, as the case may be.
(8) At the request of the Board any officer or servant of
a public corporation may, with the consent of such officer
or servant, and the governing body of the public corpora-
tion be temporarily appointed to the staff of the
Board for such perlod as may be determined by the Board
with like consent, or be permanently appointed to such
staff on such ierms and condtions including those relating
to pension or provident fund rights, as may be agreed upon
hy the Board and the said public corporation, .
